name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
description: A major historic Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar, famous for its towering gopurams and intricate sculpture work.
stories: Legend says Goddess Meenakshi ruled Madurai and married Lord Sundareswarar, symbolizing the union of power and virtue.
The temple complex has been an important cultural and religious center for over 2500 years.

name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site built by Raja Raja Chola I, known for its massive vimana (tower) and Chola-era murals.
stories: Built in the 11th century, the temple is an architectural marvel of the Chola dynasty.
Local guides often tell stories of the giant bronze Nandi and the temple's sophisticated structural design.

name: Shore Temple
description: A group of structural temples on the Bay of Bengal coast, famous for Pallava rock-cut architecture and coastal views.
stories: The Shore Temple marks the culmination of the Pallava dynasty's rock-cut art and early structural temples.
Local fishermen sometimes recount sea-storm legends connected to the temple.

name: Ranganathaswamy Temple, Srirangam
description: One of the largest functioning Hindu temple complexes in the world, dedicated to Lord Ranganatha (Vishnu).
stories: The temple has a long history of medieval patronage and elaborate festival traditions.
Many legends tie the temple to the river Kaveri and local devotional poets.

name: Hogenakkal Falls
description: A scenic waterfall on the Kaveri river, often called the "Niagara of India" for its rocky cascades and coracle rides.
stories: Local folklore speaks of the falls' medicinal waters and the ancient communities that lived nearby.
Coracle rides are a traditional experience visitors should try with a licensed guide.

name: Velankanni Basilica
description: A major Christian pilgrimage site known for its 16th-century origins and miracles attributed to Our Lady of Good Health.
stories: Pilgrims from across India come during the annual festival to seek blessings and attend processions.
The basilica's architecture blends colonial and local styles and has many votive offerings.
